intro: Chironia rosacea, commonly known as the pink rosemallow, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia and Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, pink to red flowers that bloom in summer. Its leaves are ovate and covered in soft, fuzzy hairs. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found near water bodies.
